Pre-Game Insights: The Los Angeles Clippers are sixth in the Western Conference with a 18-13 record, while the New Orleans Pelicans are 15th with a 5-27 record.
The Clippers average 109.4 points per game with a +2.3 point differential, while the Pelicans average 106.5 points per game and have a 1-18 record in games decided by 10 points or more.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers are shooting 46.8% from the field, 1.7% lower than the Pelicans' opponents' 48.5% field goal percentage this season.
Brandon Ingram is shooting 46.5% and averaging 22.2 points for the Pelicans, while James Harden is averaging 21.9 points, 6.4 rebounds, 8.1 assists, and 1.5 steals for the Clippers.
Others: The Pelicans have a 1-9 record in their last 10 games, averaging 113.4 points, 42.8 rebounds, 25.8 assists, 10.9 steals, and 5.4 blocks per game, while their opponents have averaged 122.3 points per game.
